common_issues.title: Pieces OS & VS Code Extension Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting the VS Code extension to Pieces OS, particularly within remote environments like WSL2 and DevContainers.  Common problems include Copilot rendering failures and API connection errors. Solutions involve configuring custom URLs, adjusting network settings, and ensuring compatibility between Pieces OS and extension versions.

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* The issue concerns the inability to render Copilot in the Pieces VSCode extension.
* The problem might be related to WSL2 networking issues, snap installation, or Pieces OS.
* Possible solutions include enabling systemd support, enabling dns-tunnel in WSL2, and troubleshooting snap installation.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot fails to render in the Pieces VSCode extension.
* The healthcheck API returns "ok" but Copilot remains unavailable.
* The root cause of the issue is unclear, and WSL2, snap installation, or Pieces OS might be involved.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Enabling systemd support in WSL2 config.
* Enabling dns-tunnel in WSL2.
* Troubleshooting snap installation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The investigation is ongoing.
* The user will update the ticket with further information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation mentions a similar issue discussed in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-remote-release/issues/4536.
* The user references various Microsoft developer blogs for information on systemd support and dns-tunnel in WSL2.

I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points:** * The user was experiencing issues connecting to Pieces OS from a DevContainer running VS Code. * The issue was caused by changes in Pieces OS version 11.0.0, where the default listening interface was changed to loopback. * The user tried various approaches, including different URLs and configurations, but none worked. **Problems Identified:** * The loopback interface setting prevented connections from remote instances. * The host.docker.internal resolution did not work with Webview tool windows. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * A patch was developed to allow listening on all interfaces. * A new version of the Pieces for VSCode extension was released (version 2.0.2), which included the patch. * A workaround was proposed involving a DNS entry, but it was later resolved by the patch. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue was resolved in Pieces for VSCode extension version 2.0.2. * The user successfully connected to Pieces OS from their DevContainer after updating the extension. **Additional Notes:** * The user and developer collaborated effectively to identify and resolve the issue. * The developer provided clear instructions and explanations throughout the process.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Conversation Summary: Context Issues with Python File and Line Number Wrapping

**Key points:**

* @bschwenk reported an issue where their .py file wasn't properly included in context when using Gemini 1.5 flash and gpt4o. 
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed the issue and also identified another issue with line numbers wrapping incorrectly. 
* @sam-at-pieces provided a fix for the context issue and committed it to a future release.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed that the context issue fix will be released in version 11.0.4. 
* @bschwenk expressed their gratitude to the team. 

**Problem identified:** 
* Python file wasn't included in context properly, causing Gemini to request it again.
* Line numbers were wrapping incorrectly.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
* Fix for the context issue provided and committed to a future release.
* Investigation on the line number wrapping issue ongoing. 

**Current status:** 
* Context issue fix is expected in version 11.0.4.
* Line number wrapping issue investigation ongoing. 

**Outcome:**
* context issue resolved in upcoming release
* line number wrapping issue still under investigation
* user thanked team for the fix

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Performance Issues and Bugs
common_issues.description: Users report high RAM/CPU usage with PiecesOS, sometimes reaching 100% CPU. This might be related to internet connectivity or Live Context feature. Restarting PiecesOS provides a temporary fix. Developers are working on optimizations and a potential permanent solution. Other bugs reported include software unresponsiveness and context issues with large code files.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: High Memory Usage in PiecesOS

**Key Points Raised:**

* Several users reported high RAM and CPU usage by PiecesOS, a centralized server that runs the Pieces product suite.
* One user reported memory usage exceeding 5GB, while another experienced CPU spikes of up to 120%.
* The user with high RAM usage noticed the issue was more pronounced when using Live Context.
* The developers acknowledged the issue and attributed it to the on-device ML capabilities and the use of Live Context.
* They are working on optimizations to improve performance and reduce resource consumption.

**Problems Identified:**

* High RAM and CPU usage, making PiecesOS unusable for some users.
* Live Context feature seems to contribute to the high RAM usage.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* "Optimize Memory" feature to unload some ML models and free up RAM.
* Developers are working on optimizations to improve performance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persists, but the developers are actively working on a solution.
* The "Optimize Memory" feature can help mitigate the issue temporarily.
* Some users are forced to stop using PiecesOS due to the high resource consumption.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation occurred between April 2024 and January 2025.
* The latest update from the developers is from November 2024.

related_issues.text:
Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

version: 8.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Issue:**
I am encountering difficulties with installing and launching the Pieces Windows desktop version. After a successful installation, the software fails to open properly. Despite confirming its presence in the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Download and install the Pieces Windows desktop version.
- Attempt to launch the software.
- Observe that the program does not open on the screen.
- Check the task manager to confirm the software is running in the background.

**Expected Behavior:**
Upon installation, the Pieces Windows desktop version should launch and display its interface on the screen, allowing users to interact with it

**Actual Behavior:**
After installation, the software does not open as expected. Despite running in the background according to the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**System Information:**

- Windows version: 22H2 (OS Build 19045)

**Additional Notes:**
I have attempted to troubleshoot this issue without success. Any assistance or insights into resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on Pieces OS Launch Failure

**Key Points Raised:**

- User @SoumyaSubhrajit reported the issue of Pieces OS failing to launch.
- Users @mark-at-pieces, @tolgayilmaz, @SicutDeficere, and @jchuder confirmed experiencing the same problem.
- @tolgayilmaz described the issue in detail, including the system tray icon and browser error message.
- @jchuder noted the issue occurs on both Windows and macOS.

**Problems Identified:**

- Pieces OS fails to launch when initiated from the Pieces suite or start menu.
- The Pieces Chrome extension displays an error message stating "Failed to connect to Pieces OS."
- The issue appears to affect various versions of Pieces OS, desktop app, and web extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- @nathan-courtney-pieces requested the log files for investigation.
- @mark-at-pieces suggested related issues for reference.
- @jimbobbennett inquired about the issue's persistence.
- No definitive solutions were identified in the conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue remains unresolved as of January 16, 2025.
- Users are still experiencing the launch failure across different platforms. 
- Further investigation and troubleshooting are required.
